column4: guys, you know how when you right click and do create new file > it says no templates instsalled yet? how can I install a template, so it says something like 'create new Xml file' or osmething
that's pretty much a GNOME question. Could try #gnome
I don't know if it's by default, but try `sudo apt-get install samba'
thanks
this will allow me to connect to my windows network, correct?
no this will allow your windows network to connect to your ubuntu machine.
ah okay, I thought it was the other way around.
you probably already have a driver for that. try `mount //server/share /mnt/location -t cifs'
that'd be samba+cups
dpkg -l
when I do that command, it lists tons of stuff and I cant scroll back up to see what it said at the very top, how can I make it so it it shows screenfuls at a time
using a pager. you can use more, less, most... there may be more. so prefix that command with one of those words.
so... less dpkg -i ?
ehm, I said prefix, didn't I?
heh, sorry mate. pipe it. dpkg -i | less
that is weird, it just says END at the bottom
that's because I just put dpkg -i instead of `dpkg -l | less'
i'm a little tired :)
I mean, today.
I press space to show more right? thanks bud!
or up/down pgup/pgdown k/j
and np :)
